metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18009 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In OpenCV 3.3.1, a heap-based buffer over-read exists in the functioncv::HdrDecoder::checkSignature in modules/imgcodecs/src/grfmt_hdr.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-contrib4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-core4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-dnn4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-features2d4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-flann4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-highgui4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-imgcodecs4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-imgproc4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-ml4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-objdetect4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-photo4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-shape4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-stitching4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-superres4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-video4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-videoio4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-videostab4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv-viz4.1 - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv4.1-java - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
libopencv4.1-jni - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
opencv-data - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
python3-opencv - 4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2+dfsg-4ubuntu3').
